definition: to hold/to contain/to grasp/to take hold of/handle/particle marking the following noun as a direct object/classifier for objects with handle/classifier for small objects: handful
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Only China is in a position to act as a second engine of global growth.
sentences.chinese: 只有中國在扮演着全球經濟增長的第二把手的地位。

sentences.english: Its new second-in-command was killed just last month.
sentences.chinese: 就在上個月基地組織新的第二把手也被殺死了。

definition: working hand/member of a work team/participant/(short form of 第一把手[di4 yi1 ba3 shou3]) the boss
the person in charge/the head of the leadership group
to be in a position of power
main job/day job/steady full-time job (as opposed to temporary or casual)/chief or principal post (as opposed to deputy)
to take over (as minister, manager etc)
lit. to hide the sky with one hand/to hide the truth from the masses
